gurmukhi: n SMk icq AwnIAY bnwie Awp lyhgy ] sukiRq kwb ik`qkI kbIs AOr dyhgy ]2]
transliteration: Na Shank Chit Aaneeai Banaae Aap Lahge|| Soukrit Kaah Kittakikabees Aur Dehge||2||
translation: He unhesitatingly, composed in this way the, fine epic Ramayana, which none else will be able to do.2.

gurmukhi: smwn guMg ky kvM su kYs kwib BwK hY ] Akwl kwl kI kiRpw bnwie gRMQ rwiK hY ]
transliteration: Samaan Goung Ke Kavan Su Kais Kaah(i) Bhaakh Hai|| Akaal Kaal Kikreepa Banaae Granth Raakh(i) Hai||
translation: All the poets are dumb before him, how will they compose poetry? He composed this granth by the Grace of the Lord;

gurmukhi: suBwKX kaumdI pVY gunI AsyK rIJ hY ] ibcwr AwpnI kiRqM ibsyK ic`q KIJ hY ]3]
transliteration: Soubhaakhya Kaoumadipadai Gouniasekh Reejh Hai|| Bichaar Aapanikritan Bisekh Chitt Kheejh Hai||3||
translation: The erudite scholars of language and and literature read it with pleasure; and while comparing with their own works, they get angry in their minds.3.

gurmukhi: bicqR kwbX kI kQw pivqR Awj BwKIAY ] su is`D biR`D dwienI smiRD bYx rwKIAY ]
transliteration: Bachitra Kaabya Kikathaa Pavitra Aaj Bhaakheeai|| Su Siddh Briddh Daaenisamridh Bain Raakheeai||
translation: The story of his immaculate poem which is really wonderful accomplished and powerful; this story is

gurmukhi: pivqR inrmlI mhwN bicqR kwvX k`QIAY ] pivqR Sbd aupjY cirqR ko n ik`jIAY ]4]
transliteration: Pavitra Nirmalimahaan Bachitra Kaavya Kattheeai|| Pavitra Shabad Oupjai Charitra Ko Na Kijjeeai||4||
translation: His poem is said to be extremly pure and each of its episodies is spotless, sanctified and marvelous.4.

gurmukhi: su syv kwldyv kI AByv jwn kIjIey ] pRBwq au`T qws ko mhwq nwmu lIjIey ]
transliteration: Su Sev Kaaldev Kiabhev Jaan Keejeee|| Prabhaat Outth Taas Ko Mahaat Naam(u) Leejeee||
translation: According to the instructions given in Ramayana, we should ever be in the service of the Lord; we should get up early In the morning and remember His Name;

gurmukhi: AsMK dwn dyhgy durMq SqR Gwie hY ] su pwn rwK Awpno Ajwn ko bcwie hY ]5]
transliteration: Asankh Daan Dehge Durant Shatra Ghaae Hai|| Su Paan Raakh Aapano Ajaan Ko Bachaae Hai||5||
translation: Through the glory of His Name, many mighty enemies are killed and the charities of innumerable types are bestowed; that Lord, also keeping his name on our heads, protects the ignorant people like us.5.

gurmukhi: n sMq bwr bwk hY AsMq jUJ hY blI ] ibsyK sYn Bwj hY isqM sryx inrdlI ]
transliteration: Na Sant Baar Baak Hai Asant Joojh Hai Balee|| Bisekh Sain Bhaaj Hai Sitan Daren Nirdalee||
translation: Even after the fighting of many mighty warriors, the saints remain unharmed and before the forces of agony and before the white arrows of His Grace and tranquility, the forces of agony and affliction fly away;

gurmukhi: ik Awn Awp hwQ dY bcwie moh lyhgy ] durMq Gwt AauGty ik dyKnY n dyhgy ]6]
transliteration: Ki Aan Aap Haath Dai Bachaae Moh Lehge|| Durant Ghaat Aoughate Ki Dekhnai Na Dehge||6||
translation: That Lord with His Grace will save me and I shall never pass through any condition of suffering and hardship.6.
End of the first incarnation of Valmiki.
Description of Kashyap, the second incarnation of Brahma

gurmukhi: pun Drw bHm k`Sp vqwr ] sRiq kry pwT qRIA brI cwr ] mYQnI siRSit kInI pRgws ] aupjwie dyv dwnv su bws ]7]
transliteration: Poun Dharaa Brahm Kasshap Vataar|| Srouti Dare Paath Treea Barichaar|| Maithanisrishttee Keenipragads|| Oupjaae Dev Daanav Su Baas||7||
translation: The Brahma assuming the Kashyap incarnation, recited shrutis (Vedas) and married four women, after that he created the whole world, when both gods and demons were created.7.
